info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 10 at 7:29PM CDT until July 11 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
info.description:
At 729 PM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Reports of street flooding, especially within the Downtown Dubuque area, with reports of a stranded car. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dubuque, Galena, Asbury, Bellevue, Cascade, Epworth, East Dubuque, Peosta, La Motte, Menominee, Rickardsville, Council Hill, St. Donatus, Centralia, Sageville, Bernard, Zwingle, Bankston, Durango and Rice.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT FRIDAY FOR NORTHWESTERN JACKSON, NORTHEASTERN JONES, DUBUQUE AND WESTERN JO DAVIESS COUNTIES

area.areaDesc: Dubuque, IA; Jackson, IA; Jones, IA; Jo Daviess, IL
